greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of partitions of 1 into exactly k*n+1 powers of 1/(k+1); square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
Christian Elsholtz, Clemens Heuberger, Daniel Krenn, Algorithmic counting of nonequivalent compact Huffman codes, arXiv:1901.11343 [math.CO], 2019.

Christian Elsholtz, Clemens Heuberger, Helmut Prodinger, The number of Huffman codes, compact trees, and sums of unit fractions, arXiv:1108.5964 [math.CO], Aug 30, 2011. Also IEEE Trans. Information Theory, Vol. 59, No. 2, 2013 pp. 1065-1075.
maple: b:= proc(n, r, k) option remember;
mathematica: Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 11 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Main diagonal gives A011782(n-1) for n>0.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 08 2017
